channel.title: NTP Public Time Servers on NTP: Network Time Protocol
channel.description: Recent content in NTP Public Time Servers on NTP: Network Time Protocol

item.title: Access Details
item.description: Access Policy details for this Time Server.

item.title: Access Policy
item.description: The general access policy of a Time Server. The following choices are available: Open Access - This TimeServer is open to any client complying with usage guidelines listed below. Restricted Access - This TimeServer has some access restrictions in addition to the usage guidelines listed below. Closed Access - This TimeServer is closed or requires prior arrangement for use. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all time servers unless modified by the time server operator:

item.title: Autokey
item.description: If this option is set to yes this server supports NTP Authentication using the Autokey protocol. See the AutoKey URL field and/or the Notes in the time server list entry for information about obtaining the Autokey parameters for this time server.

item.title: Autokey URL
item.description: A URL (or e-mail address) to be used to request the Autokey parameters for this time server. Use the Notes in the time server list entry for extended information that will not fit in this field.

item.title: Closed Access
item.description: Closed access time servers may not be used without prior arrangement. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all time servers unless modified by the time server operator: iburst may be used. burst may not be used. minpoll/maxpoll may not be changed below the defaults of 64 seconds and 1024 seconds respectively. Clients should honor the KOD message. Time Server IP addresses and/or hostnames may not be hard-coded in any hardware, firmware, or software without advance explicit written permission from the time server operator.

item.title: Country Code
item.description: The country name (official short name in English), as specified on the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code list, where this Time Server is located. Time servers located in the United States should use US NN where NN is the 2 letter abbreviation of the State.

item.title: Geographic Coordinates
item.description: The geographic coordinates of this Time Server.

item.title: Host Organization
item.description: The sponsoring organization or owner or hosting provider of this Time Server.

item.title: Notification Message
item.description: An e-mail message to a Time Server admin announcing your intent to use their server. If you require a Notification Message you must set your Access Policy to Restricted Access. You should send a Notification Message to the Time Server admin if this option is set to Yes in that Time Server’s list entry.

item.title: Open Access
item.description: An open access time server may be polled by any client complying with the usage guidelines listed below. Clients should respect any declared Service Area, but are not required to do so. Operators of open access time servers may request, but may not require, a Notification Message prior to use. Usage Guidelines The following usage guidelines apply to all time servers unless modified by the time server operator: iburst may be used.

item.title: Pool Member
item.description: This Time Server is included in the pool.ntp.org time server pool if this option to Yes.

item.title: Restricted Access
item.description: A restricted access time server does not require prior arrangements before use but has some restrictions on its use in addition to the usage guidlines listed below. These restrictions include, but are not limited to: Notification Message Service only to clients within a specified Service Area Service only to certain types of institutions Maximum number of clients Minimum poll interval Users are reponsible for reviewing the list entry for a Restricted Access server prior to using it.

item.title: Rules of Engagement
item.description: As the load on the hosts supporting NTP primary (stratum 1) time service is heavy and always increasing, clients should avoid using the primary servers whenever possible. In most cases the accuracy of the NTP secondary (stratum 2) servers is only slightly degraded relative to the primary servers and, as a group, the secondary servers may be just as reliable. As a general rule, a secondary server should use a primary server only under the following conditions:

item.title: Server Contact
item.description: The e-mail address to be used for contacting the time server operator. Inclusion of the operator’s name or other information (e.g. telephone number) is optional.

item.title: Server Location
item.description: The physical location (e.g. City, State/Province) of this Time Server.

item.title: Server Stratum
item.description: The time server stratum is the position at which a time server operates in the NTP hierarchy. A stratum 1 time is directly connected to a reference clock and is at the top of the time server hierarchy. A stratum 2 time server receives the time from one, or more, stratum 1 time servers. Stratum 2 time servers are not significantly less accurate than stratum 1 time servers. Use the Inactive option of Server Stratum to mark a Time Server as Inactive.

item.title: Server Synchronization
item.description: Information about how this Time Server is synchronized. Some operators include information about the server hardware, operating system, and version of NTP.

item.title: Service Area
item.description: The geographic and/or network area this Time Server is intended to serve.

item.title: Symmetric Key
item.description: If this option is set to yes this server supports NTP Authentication using a Symmetric Key (e.g. a shared secret). See the Symmetric Key URL field and/or the Notes in the time server list entry for information about obtaining the Symmetric Key for this time server.

item.title: Symmetric Key Type
item.description: The symmetric key type supported by this Time Server.

item.title: Symmetric Key URL
item.description: A URL (or e-mail address) to be used to request a Symmetric Key for this time server. Use the Notes in the time server list entry for extended information that will not fit in this field.

item.title: Time Server
item.description: A time server is a system which acquires the correct time from a local reference clock and/or remote time servers and will answer time requests from other systems.

item.title: Use DNS
item.description: If this option is set to Yes users should put the hostname in their ntp.conf file instead of the IP address.
